data.title: Louisville shows this week: Patton Oswalt, Death Cab for Cutie & more
data.meta_description: From Patton Oswalt to Death Cab for Cutie to The Get Up Kids, there's something for everyone this week in Louisville.
data.text:
SUNDAY, JULY 7

Uptown Band. Part of the Summer Concerts at Willow Park. 7 p.m., Willow Park, 1402 Willow Ave. Bring a donation of a canned good, toothpaste, toothbrush, paper towels, dishwashing liquid or deodorant to support Highlands Community Ministries Dare to Care Food Pantry. Free.

Patton Oswalt Live. 8 p.m., Louisville Palace, 625 S. Fourth St. Tickets start at $37.50. 800-745-3000.

Death Cab for Cutie. 7:30 p.m., Iroquois Amphitheater, 1080 Amphitheater Road. Tickets start at $45. iroquoisamphitheater.com.

More: Why you might see Death Cab for Cutie running through Cherokee Park this weekend

TUESDAY, JULY 9

“Ring of Fire: The Music of Johnny Cash.” The legendary songbook of Johnny Cash comes to life in Actors Theatre of Louisville show. Tuesday-Friday, 7 p.m.; 3 and 8 p.m. Saturday, Victor Jory Theatre, 316 W. Main St. Ends Aug. 18. Tickets start at $51. 502-584-1205.

You may like: Here's your ultimate 2019 guide for free outdoor music in Louisville

THURSDAY, JULY 11

The Get Up Kids. 8:30 p.m., Mercury Ballroom, 611 S. 4th St. Tickets start at $19. mercuryballroom.com; 800-745-3000.

The Local Honeys. Part of Bourbon and Botanicals Music Series. 6:30-8 p.m., Yew Dell Botanical Gardens, 6220 Old La Grange Road, Crestwood, Kentucky. The evening begins with a plant walk at 5:30 p.m. Beer, wine and bourbon and food from 3rd Turn Brewing will be available for purchase. $9, $5 for ages 6-17 and seniors, free for ages 5 and younger and Yew Dell members. 502-241-4788.

FRIDAY, JULY 12

The Forecastle Festival. Friday-Sunday, 1:30-11 p.m., Waterfront Park, 129 E. River Road. More than 50 acts on four stages, bourbon experience at the Gonzo Bar and eat, drink and shop at Kentucky Landing. Performers include The Killers, Nelly, Anderson Park & The Free Nationals, Judah & The Lion, Cold War Kids, Maggie Rogers, Moon Taxi, Midland, Tyler Childers, Andrew Bird, Dawes and many more. Weekend pass: $184.50 and general admission: $199.50; $274.50 Yacht Club (access to air-conditioned, multi-level Mary M. Miller Steamboat docked at Harbor Lawn and the Boathouse on the Great Lawn); $449.50 VIP (access to Yacht Club benefits, special entrance into festival, air-conditioned restroom trailers, dedicated VIP bar and free massage and styling stations; $30 Bourbon Lodge includes mug, re-entry into the Lodge with or without drink tickets (membership does not include a festival pass or access to festival). Admission per day starts at $89.50. forecastlefest.com.

Nightrain: The Guns N' Roses Tribute Experience. 9 p.m., Mercury Ballroom, 611 S. 4th St. Tickets start at $10. mercuryballroom.com; 800-745-3000.

The Derby City Playwrights New Play Festival. Friday-next Sunday, The Bards Town, 1801 Bardstown Road Friday-Sunday. "gods play": Christopher Pentheus must endure an epic road trip to save the script that was stolen from him, 7:30 p.m. Friday. "Punk Snot": A story of loss, betrayal and redemption set against the gritty world of punk rock, Friday, 10 p.m. "Neutral Position": A couple’s plans for a home and family are blown up when their careers put them on opposite sides of the death penalty argument, Saturday, 8 p.m. "On the Road": A mother and daughter travel the country’s zoos in search of a long-lost winning coloring sheet, next Sunday, 5:30 p.m. "Noke Cake": A love story about the visible and the invisible, next Sunday, 8 p.m. Ends July 28. Tickets are $18 in advance, $20 day of show; festival pass can be purchased for all five shows for $80. thebardstowntheatre.org/derbycityplay.html.

You may like: Your guide to free outdoor movies and shows this summer in Louisville

Endless Summer, Soul Kitchen. Part of the Shoe Sensation Summer Concert Series. 7 p.m., Jeffersonville RiverStage, 100 W. Riverside Drive, Jeffersonville, Indiana. Free.

Appalatin, Grizzly Goat. Part of the Bicentennial Park Summer Concert Series. 6:30 p.m., Bicentennial Park, corner of Spring and Pearl streets. Free.

Thumper & the Plaid Rabbits, Tyrone Cotton. Part of the FridayFest Concert Series. 6 p.m., Highview Park, 7201 Outer Loop. Concessions available. Free.

Early Autumn. Part of the Concerts in the Park Series. 7 p.m., Sonny Brewster Bandstand, Warder Park, 109 E. Court Ave., Jeffersonville, Indiana. Presented by Jeffersonville Main Street and the Jeffersonville Parks Department. Free.

SATURDAY, JULY 13

Almost Selena. 9 p.m., Mercury Ballroom, 611 S. 4th St. Tickets start at $12. mercuryballroom.com; 800-745-3000.

NEXT SUNDAY, JULY 14

85 South. 7 p.m., Louisville Palace, 625 S. Fourth St. Tickets start at $40. 800-745-3000.

Joe Debow. Part of the Summer Concerts at Willow Park. 7 p.m., Willow Park, 1402 Willow Ave. Bring a donation of a canned good, toothpaste, toothbrush, paper towels, dish washing liquid or deodorant to support Highlands Community Ministries Dare to Care Food Pantry. Free.

J.D. Shelburne. Part of Middletown Concerts in the Park. 5:30 p.m., Wetherby Park, 11803 Old Shelbyville Road. Food and drinks provided by the city, prepared by the Lions Club. Pets and alcohol not allowed. Free

Send arts event info to listings@courier-journal.com.
